content.description: The tumor suppressor protein <math alttext="p 53" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p53</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> binds to DNA and activates target genes, which results in the synthesis of <math alttext="p 21" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p21</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C D 95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CD95</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and other proteins. The <math alttext="p 21" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p21</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein promotes cell-cycle arrest, whereas the <math alttext="C D 95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CD95</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein promotes apoptosis.
content.question: Which of the following will most likely result from a loss of <math alttext="p 53" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p53</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> function?

choices.label: Rapid cell growth without cell division
Increased expression of <math alttext="p 53" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p53</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> target genes

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
